caption: The Plateau coffee tables, designed by Büro Famos, comprises just two simple wooden components  a top and a base. The top is made in solid wood and its distinctive edge emphasises the highly skilled carpentry and creates a beautifully rounded design. The base is made of moulded veneer and also contains a concealed storage compartment, while the top can also serve as a tray. #bolia #plateau #coffeetable

Welcome to a world of design. A world to explore and enjoy. A safe haven, a breathing space, a creative playground - for you and for us. Built on simplicity and craft that has stood its ground through thick and thin, and time and taste. Welcome to our 2020 Spring Collection launching Monday. Stay tuned! #bolia #springcollection

caption: If you ask us, the perfect New Year’s Eve cocktail should be a blend of classic notes suitable for most, a light enjoyment that refreshes the palate, and last but not least – it should ooze glamour and elegance. caption: Ocean is one of a kind furniture fabric with unique qualities that can be seen in the dye, where even the smallest parts are dyed before the threads are spun. Ocean has a soft surface structure, is 100% free of PFC, and manufactured without use of water in production, which gives Ocean a more sustainable origin. Ocean is tested to outdoor usage and also certified to OEKO-TEX standards, which ensures quality and durability. #bolia #ocean #fabric

caption: Dress your home for Spring with classic cushions in different fabrics. #bolia #classic #cushion

Bolia Design Award 2019 8/8: BLIMP CHAIR by Studio Sløyd.  Designed to highlight the contrast between materials, the massive rounded pine seat of the Blimp chair meets the hard lines of the steel doing just that. This modern dining chair came to be using only subtractive manufacturing methods giving it its distinct organic look.  The goal for the form of expression was to organically shape the wood to a point where it would visually appear to be melting over the frame. To be able to explore this design we had to do a more modern take on traditional craftmanship and do this with a fully automated CNC milling machine. Most of the design process was done through 3D modeling and creating a close to realistic environment for us to see the design as if it were real. This type of rapid prototyping opened for an extremely quick process as every change, big or small, was implemented within seconds.  Vote for your favourite design via link in bio. #bolia #boliadesignawards2019

caption: Bolia Design Award 2019 7/8: Marbled salts by Roxane Lahidji.  Marbled salts explores future manufacturing possibilities by reinventing salt as a sustainable material for design applications.  The research focused on predicting a possible future where materials are no longer excavated but recycled composites infinitely renewable. The project uses salt’s self-binding properties to mould a set of small side tables and low stools resembling luxurious stones. The design was focused on rare or costly shapes, as such objects would generate a significant amount of material waste if produced from natural stone Coal powder and natural pigments mimic the aesthetics of expensive natural stone such as marble  Marbled salts is made from 95% Sea Salt - one of the most available and cheap resources on the planet, and was developed with an intermediary lifetime in order to remain easily reusable and follow consumption fashions. Inspired from old marble faking techniques Marbled Salts draws a contradictory parallel between the flexible versatility of salt and the material language of heavy and solid rock.  Vote for your favourite design via link in bio. #bolia #boliadesignawards2019

caption: Bolia Design Award 2019  6/8: Frege by Michele Armellini.  Frege, a loungy chair handmade out of rattan - a natural material exceptionally sustainable due to the plant growing time.  Frege exploits rattans’ most appreciated mechanical features (stiffness and flexibility) by approaching the whole design process starting from a very technical system: a self-locking structure.  At first sight it’s impossible to understand which are the pieces and how they are put together, indeed every piece won’t work without the others.  Vote for your favourite design via link in bio. #bolia #boliadesignawards2019

Bolia Design Award 2019 5/8: Icup by Marleen Schönfelder.  Icup. An egg is served as if it were floating on a cloud. A square with a hole - folded diagonally and turned into an eggcup.  Made of stainless steel, matt or glossy, and always unbreakable and stackable - a fine underpainting and clever presentation for everything egg-shaped on the breakfast table. All of them, whether brown, white, spotted or colourful, will float into the Icup.  Vote for your favourite design via link in bio. #bolia #boliadesignawards2019

caption: Bolia Design Award 2019 4/8: 13Rosas by Cenlitrosmetrocadrado.  13Rosas is a system of equipment for social areas. The design process explores the functional aspects and interactions in this context and offers a light, flexible and aesthetic solution.  A piece of furniture aimed to meet, share and socialize. With a Nordic aesthetic it is based on subtle nuances of blues and greys that contrast with the intensity of orange. The global approach wants to be timeless both in form and in the color palette in order to be subtly integrated into any open space.  Wooden planes are used on these light structures in order to create the seating and working surfaces. On the other hand, cushions made of textile and foam can be easily combined in order to compose the rest area according to the different needs.  Vote for your favourite design via link in bio. #bolia #boliadesignawards2019

Bolia Design Award 2019 3/8: Moonlight by Fabio Pugliese  Swipe, slide, scroll. A gesture is a way to face technology, in a time where relations between objects and users are becoming ephemeral.  Moonlight affirms the importance of gestures in creating a different relationship between the user and the object. The intensity of the light is modulated by sliding the sphere on the structure. The pivotal stick, inserted into the light source and linked to an internal dimmer, will regulate the light.  The materials chosen for the presentation underline the simplicity of the shapes and interaction but a possible variation is to use a wooden structure with a square section instead of the proposed tubular metal frame.  Vote for your favourite design via link in bio. #bolia #boliadesignawards2019

caption: Bolia Design Award 2019  2/8: Vivus by Ditte Willads Petersen.  Vivus is a contemporary piece of furniture, designed to make waste sorting nice and easy. The idea behind Vivus was to create a natural solution for sorting and storing of waste.  Vivus should not appear as traditional trash bins but as an integrated part of the interior design, which could naturally be placed in different areas of the home. The design consists of four units made of moulded plywood and a top piece made of solid wood. Each unit contains light steel frames where a reusable bag of woven polypropylene is placed around – and all bags are easy to clean and carry.  Vote for your favourite design via link in bio. #bolia #boliadesignawards2019

caption: Bolia Design Award 2019 - 1/8: Twisted Concrete Bench by Badih Rameh.  Twisted Concrete Bench is Designed for indoor and outdoor spaces and features a ‘Twist' that creates the structure from one side, guides the form, and provides smooth seating for up to three, forming it into Fluid Furniture piece, expressing a sense of movement and softer lines.  The concrete is sanded 3 times after the removal of the mold, and cured for 7 days, this helps to harden and bond with internal materials and to reinforce the structure.  Vote for your favourite design via link in bio. #bolia #boliadesignawards2019

caption: Loaded with innovative ideas, big dreams and great talent and all you need is your big break, your discovery, your ticket to the ride? The Bolia Design Awards was created to help you with just that. We want to find the freshest minds out there, to identify and nurture the talent that will define the future of furniture design, and with open arms we welcome you.  We love new classics, get high on creative icons and we tend to fall in love with aesthetic, yet functional designs that improve or inspire our everyday life. And oh, we really love sustainable materials and good craftsmanship with fine attention to detail. Sharpen your pencils and get to work - the competition is on and the deadline is April 1st. #bolia #boliadesignawards

caption: We design furniture, but we are so much more than just a traditional furniture design company. Through creative collabs we are trying to blurr the lines between art, fashion, design, music and now mountaineering, too. On May 19 last year, the Danish professional mountaineer Jakob Urth, had the world at his feet at a height of 8,848 metres from the world’s highest mountain, Mount Everest. We went along for the ride and sponsored the adventure with equipment and moral support. #bolia #jakoburth #blurringthelines

caption: Set your expectations sky high with the new Clouds fabric by Bolia. Look, feel, touch and you’ll be able to tell that the designer Joa Herrenknecht has been deeply inspired by the characteristic Nordic landscape, the roaring ocean and the pure light that can’t be found anywhere else. Clouds is produced by Guldbrandsdalens Uldvarefabrik founded in Norway in 1887, one of the last traditional wool weaving companies in Scandinavia. Here the wool is prepared, dyed and woven to perfection in order to give you the very best of the amazing North, right in your living room. #bolia #nooneliveslikeyou #clouds

caption: Bolia Design Award 2018 - 8/8 ———————— 10:1 Series by Christian Hammer Juhl  10:1 is a series of furniture consisting of a sofa, a lounge chair and a stool. The furniture is made from special dense foam that allows it to be compressed down to 10% of its original size under vacuum. This makes it more sustainable to transport the furniture from industry to store, and easier to move from store to home, and home to home.  The furniture is inspired by the effect of globalization on our increasing mobility, and the impact of urbanization on the decreasing size of our living spaces. 10:1 hopes to accommodate these new ways of living by creating ease in our nomadic lifestyle where we move from place to place, or may change the living spaces in our home. #bolia #designaward #vote
comments_text: @chr.h.j 🔥🔥🔥$Aldo inspired by Gaetano Pesce...$👏👏💥👌$

caption: Bolia Design Award 2018 - 7/8 ———————— Latti Sideboard by Ewa Kurowska  Latti is a simple sideboard cabinet that is very functional for storage and display. Inspired by Scandinavian tambour-style door cabinet I wanted to create very simple and contemporary piece. The exterior sides of the unit are composed of linked, wooden, rounded slats that are fixed to a wooden surface base. The piece features 2 push-open hinged doors revealing plenty of interior storage for any goodies. #bolia #designaward #vote

caption: Bolia Design Award 2018 - 6/8 ———————— Nanashi Installation by Gosia Hinz  Open and closed spaces are the contradictions that constitute the essence of architecture. Isolation is conducive to rest, self-reflection and concentration that are necessary to achieve mental and spiritual comfort. A closed, individual space gives the human a sense of security and allows him to identify with it. In turn, open spaces support a sense of freedom, creativity and process of integration with the society. There is no golden rule, which simply says what kind of space we need to live comfortably. Comfort is a variable mixture of physical, emotional and intellectual feelings depending on each other, which makes it impossible to measure.  I decided to beat the dualistic problem of human's space needs by creation the possibility of interior's personalisation. I designed a compact screen- NANASHI. #bolia #designaward #vote
comments_text: Wow, love IT! 👌$Really 🖤 it!! Will this be produced? 💛✨$Gorgeous!$Awesome!$

caption: Bolia Design Award 2018 - 5/8 ———————— Bean Lamp by Gunnar Nygren  Sleep. A vital part of our existence. Despite its importance a well thought out bedroom hasn’t been the priority in the world of design. But the interest is growing. The effect of a rested body and mind is not to be underestimated. That’s why I designed Bean. For everyone’s special and intimate place. Bean replaces bare light bulbs hanging in the middle of bedrooms surrounded by void. #bolia #designaward #vote

caption: Bolia Design Award 2018 - 4/8 —————————————— 0.6 Chair by Joachim Froment  Europe and North America account for about two thirds of the global production and consumption of sawnwood (which hovers at 5OO million cubic meters a year) with an estimated $40 trillion according to an FAO report. In the last 300 years we have cut about 40% of global forests following WWF. Based on historical trends, the production and consumption of wood products are expected to increase. OECD speak about a Wood harvesting grew by 20% between 1980 and 2008. Across the board, wooden chairs weigh between 6 and 15kg, which means that it is important to design long-lasting products and reduce the quantity of wood per product to counterbalance this market trend.  How to design strong wooden furniture with a minimum amount of wood? Laminated wood has been developed in the 1950s with Eames chairs and has shown great mechanical improvements for decades since. However, wood consumption since the 1950s has also drastically increased. We need to improve and design better with less material. 0.6 Chair is a dining chair and café chair with a new process of laminated wood. A combination of wood veneer and carbon fibre fabric highly reinforces the whole structure and brings down the thickness of this chair to only 0.6mm. Structural curves and angles in the design help this chair being incredibly strong and only requires 3 to 5 wooden veneers (depending of the thickness of the chosen veneer) with a total weight of under 2kg.  The aim of this project was to create a piece with a mini- mum of material, a product often used but that manifest the fragility of our ecosystem and the preciosity of material. This chair is designed to be light, robust and that last longer. #bolia #designaward #vote

Bolia Design Award 2018 - 3/8 ———————- Nomad Chair by Johannes Lindner  The Normad chair follows the idea of a very simple and reduced but modern chair and is a fusion between tradition and innovation. The chair refers to an old traditional farmers chair with its simplicity and stringiness.  This elegant interpretation of a chair based on the Scandinavian design tradition with its matter for simple forms and good quality. Normad exudes Scandinavian lightness and matches it with the modern urbanity - where there is a requirement for functionality and flexibility - and where aesthetics play a central role.  The chair Normad can be used very flexible for example as a dining chair or a single chair in the porch. The prominent horizonal element of the back enable a very easy movement of the chair and can invite you to overhang your coat. The seate is out of moulded oak or ask veneer in natural and black. #bolia #designaward #vote

Bolia Design Award 2018 - 2/8 ————————— Pebble Sofa by Santiago Bautista  Reading a book, having a coffee, watching a show, taking a nap... a sofa is much more than just a furniture for seating. And yet, with such a flexible nature, its design remains to be very rigid, symmetric and confined. Pebble is an experiment that aims to rethink the traditional configuration of a sofa and explore the possibilities of this object.  The main idea was to create a fun and dynamic element that will extend beyond its boundaries embracing the adjacent furniture and inviting the user to find their preferred spot... Just as we would do on a pile of rocks in nature. #bolia #designaward #vote

The materiality of the rug contributes to a warm and pleasant atmosphere to the room. #bolia #designaward #vote

comments_text: @bolialiving Tusinde tak for alle de fine og rosende ord om Bolia og dejligt du er vild med vores nye kollektion. Trofaste kunder som dig er vi stolte af 😍  Bedste hilsner, Bolia$Good shot 👏$Tillykke med jeres smukke nye kollektion. Jeg har for over 150.000 kr Bolia indbo samet på mine beskedne kvadratmeter, og hver eneste lille genstand er et kunststykke og en kontinuerlig kilde til inspiration og glæde! Jeg er til stadighed nyforelsket i alt, hvad jeg har fra Bolia. Jeg tror på, at lykke er en evne, vi alle har til at føle, og den kan ikke købes for penge. Med én enkelt undtagelse: At komme træt hjem, smide tøjet og lade sig falde bagover nøgen i et bjerg af Ritz-beklædte velourpuder fra Bolia. Dét er den eneste form for lykke, der kan købes for penge. Og den er dét værd! Tak for jeres lækre kollektioner, jeres inspirerende præsentationer, og jeres helt vidunderlige personale i jeres flotte butikker, som jeg besøger mindst hver uge. En kæmpe hilsen til butikken på Vesterbrogade  Michael, Annette, og alle de andre. @boliacom I kan være SÅ stolte af at kunne kalde de skønne mennesker for jeres medarbejdere. De fås ikke bedre! caption: So here you are full of big dreams, big ideas and big talent. You need your big break. Your discovery, your ticket to the ride? Well this is it. The Bolia Design Awards exists with one big mission in mind. To find the freshest minds out there, to identify and nurture the talent that will define the future of furniture design, and with open arms we welcome you.  We love new classics, get high on creative icons and we tend to fall in love with aesthetic, yet functional designs that improve or inspire our everyday life. And oh, we really love organic materials and good craftsmanship with fine attention to detail. Sharpen your pencils and get to work - the game is on and the link is in bio 👊 #bolia #designaward #competitionison

comments_text: Hej A-M,  Jag beklagar att du har haft upplevelsen av att det har varit rörigt i samband med din beställning. Vi behöver ditt ordernummer för kunna kolla upp status din order. Vänligen skicka ditt ordernummer till kundservice@bolia.com.  Önskar dig en trevlig dag!  Hälsningar  Solveig/Bolia$@saskiarch$Hej Anna-Märta,  Beklagar att det har varit så här rörigt med din kommunikation med oss.  Skicka gärna ditt order nummer till kundeservice@bolia.com, så kollar vi upp saken direkt.  Önskar dig en trevlig dag!  med vänliga hälsningar Solveig/Bolia$💥💥💥$24/11 ska det stå och inte 294/11$Hej Bolia! Måste tyvärr säga att er kundtjänst är väldigt rörig och svarar långsamt. Beställde varor för  hemleverans den 24/11. Mailade dem om jag kunde få varorna levererat den 27:e istället. Det tog tid att få svar. När jag väl fick det så svarade de att jag får varorna den 294/11. Precis som ordern låg ursprungligen. Mailade igen och fick svar att  den 27:e inte hade någon  rutt som passade min adress och att leveransen var ändrad till den 29/11. Då mailade jag igen och frågade om de kunde ändra tillbaka till mitt ursprungsdatum, samt bekräfta att de isåfall ringer en timme innan. Efter lång tid fick jag svar att och ytterligare förvirrade mail fick jag svar att varorna är färdiga först den 27/11. Så frågan återstår fortfarande. När kommer varorna? Riktigt besviken när man väljer ett nytt alternativ och betalar mycket pengar. caption: Back to basics! The Bolia bike is an ode to the 60's Tour de France bikes. In those days, the frames were still made of steel and assembled by hand. They all featured a leather saddle and retro handlebar tape.  Are you up for a ride with the Amstel bike for that 60's feeling in your 2016 setting?  #boliacom #NoOneLivesLikeYou #BoliaCityBike

In our beautiful world of design there's always a lot going on, and we want to share all of our findings, news and experiences with you. That’s why we do our best to create inspiring newsletters with a relevant and positive content.  Sign up today!  We will respond by sending you a guide on the season's latest trends - completely for free.  #boliacom #NoOneLivesLikeYou #BoliaNewsletter

caption: We have invited some of Scandinavia’s most trendsetting DJs to play a live set –in our new sofa environments.  What better way to celebrate the launch of a brand new collection with a chillful sofa session with the awesome Swedish DJ and electro pop duo CANVAS. Behind CANVAS you will find two brothers from the west coast of Sweden with a background in hardcore bands, sneakers and skateboarding.  Enjoy the good tunes, drenched in plenty of sofa chill. Link in bio.  #Fortheloveofmusic #sofasessions

caption: Us by Other – The Bolia Design`Team  No two people are alike, and the same goes for our more than 40 gifted designers. No matter where in the world they come from, they have a passion for defining New Scandinavian Design. They are the cream of the crop anddecicated to creating the new, the inspired and the original.  Meet them all at Bolia.com.  #Nooneliveslikeyou #Boliacom
comments_text: 👍👍👍🙌$@boliacom I have a dream. I want to be a designer, actually I am a designer right now. I have been working as a kitchen cabinet designer for two years in Chinese company and I had my own workshop in Iran, also I have one experience of making kitchen cabinet in Turkey. I can work with MDF and wood, from designing, cutting, assembling to installing wooden products. I know 3D max and Autocad very well. I have so many ideas but I don't know how and where I should start. I really like to have a contact with your designers.$Great team!!$👌💛$

caption: For the love of Roskilde Festival –and Danish fashion, food and design.  At this year’s Roskilde Festival, artists will be in for a very special treat.  The Artist Village by RAINS, will welcome guests with nothing but love and good stuff straight out of Denmark.  The bar is operated by the Danish fashion brand Rains Journal.  The Michelin-starred restaurant Relæ / Manfreds will work their magic.  B&O Play is taking care of the great sound.  And yes – tables, chairs, sofas, lamps and accessories by us.  #rf16 #boliacom #orangefeeling #rainsjournal #beoplay #restaurantrelæ #manfredscph

caption: Mara sofa designed by Kressel + Schelle at @heimaartresidency 🌟 HEIMA is a multidisciplinary art residency for emerging and established artists located in Seyðisfjörður, East Iceland.  The 350 square meter house and studio space is dedicated to facilitate and inspire creative manifestations and artistic explorations on a local, national and international level.  HEIMA is shared by multiple artist at the time which creates a space where collaboration and cross-pollination easily occurs.  Currently, HEIMA houses artist Laura Tack.  Photo credit 📷 @renaudcambuzat  Curious to know more? Check out the video documentary by Renaud Cambuzat. Link in bio 👆🏻  #Heimaartresidency #Boliacom #Renaudcambuzat

caption: BOLIA PRESENTS: INSIDE AN ART RESIDENCY - HEIMA  Bolia is proud to present a visual glimpse inside an art residency located between sheer mountain walls and open sea on the east coast of Iceland. caption: SHARE YOUR AMSTERDAM WITH US – AND WIN A GIFT VOUCHER WORTH 2.000 EURO! 💸  Perhaps you’ve already heard the good news. Bolia is opening in Amsterdam in December! We will pick a winner on December 11th. #BoliaLovesAmsterdam #Boliacom

caption: The Customer Prize in Bolia Design Award 2015. This very special prize goes to - all decided by voting fans from around the world - Lisa Merk and Thalea Schamlenberg who together designed a brilliant and very clever new furniture to all us forgetful people :) Lisa Merk and Thalea Schmalenberg won with their furniture 'Remind Me'. Consider how helpful a piece of furniture would be if it helps us to think about important things? »remind me« acts as a storage area for keys, cellphones or purses and comes with a motion sensor that lights up the bulb on top of the sideboard, when coming close. Because of this, we will be reminded whenever we are about to leave our residence. A brass bar on the left side of the sideboard gives space for letters. The sideboard is constructed out of oak and a foot of powder-coated steel and finally finished with brass mounts.  #designaward15 #boliadesignaward #upcomming #design #scandinavian #talent

caption: Sanna Völker is the 3rd winner of this year Bolia Design Award. Sanna designed a beautiful piece of art - a candle holder named 'Snug'. Snug is a candle holder of stone with the ability to appear rustic and embellished - or simple and neat. The candles seem to be captured in an open mould, in a loose yet sturdy embrace. Stone was chosen for its natural weight, beauty and possibility of diversity. The candle holder is designed for standard dripless candles where these are fixed by pressure. #designaward15 #bolia #upcomingdesigners #design

caption: Congratulation to Matthias Lehner who won the 2nd prize in Bolia Design Award 15 with his Flap Bar Cabinet.  Flap is a modern reinterpretation of a classic bar cabinet. Like a treasure chest – it’s simple wooden box, taking care of its hidden contents and stimulate people’s curiosity to open it. Even though it’s originally intended to be a mini bar there are many other possibilities of storage use. #bolia #designaward15 #upcomingdesigners #amazingdesign #scandinavian #design #boliadesignaward

caption: 1st price Andreas Vang - The tectonic watch takes a new approach to the classic watch by putting a dynamic layer of keys on top of the clock’s hands. time can hereby both be felt and seen as shadows on the watch’s surface. the tectonic watch’s simple and geometric idiom gives it a sense of unity and places it as a natural continuation in the scandinavian design tradition. #designaward2015 #tectonicwatch @andreasvang #thewinneris #scandinaviandesign #upcomming

caption: Marrakesh Berber rugs come from the Atlas mountains and are all handmade to the highest quality. According to tradition, the local Berbers who create these rugs are only allowed to spend three days a week weaving, so it takes a long time to complete each rug, which all differ in terms of colour and size. According to superstition, the large diamond shape on the rug keeps evil spirits away and protects the rug’s owner.
